title: DeepSeek R1 claimed to match GPT-4 on reasoning benchmarks
summary: Multiple posts claiming DeepSeek R1 distilled models match or exceed GPT-4 on standard reasoning benchmarks. Needs independent verification on adversarial tasks.

title: Qwen 2.5 Max announced — 100B+ MoE model
summary: Alibaba releases Qwen 2.5 Max, a mixture-of-experts model. Claims competitive with GPT-4o on multiple benchmarks.

title: "Local inference is now cost-competitive with API for production workloads"
summary: Podcast discussion claiming that with current hardware prices and model efficiency, local inference breaks even with API costs at ~1000 requests/day. Testable with Ziggy's own DGX Spark data.

title: Claude Code Daily Benchmarks for Degradation Tracking
summary: A benchmark for tracking degradation in Claude code, which could be useful for evaluating the model's performance over time. The claim is testable and can be verified through experimentation.

title: Kimi Released Kimi K2.5, Open-Source Visual SOTA-Agentic Model
summary: Kimi has released an open-source visual SOTA-agentic model, which could be a significant development in the field of AI. The release can be evaluated based on its performance and capabilities.

title: PaperAudit-Bench: Benchmarking Error Detection in Research Papers for Critical Automated Peer Review
summary: A benchmark for evaluating error detection in research papers, which could improve the peer review process. The research can be evaluated based on its methodology and findings.

title: HEART: A Unified Benchmark for Assessing Humans and LLMs in Emotional Support Dialogue
summary: A benchmark for evaluating the performance of humans and LLMs in emotional support dialogue, which could lead to improvements in conversational AI. The research can be evaluated based on its methodology and findings.

title: OPT-Engine: Benchmarking the Limits of LLMs in Optimization Modeling via Complexity Scaling
summary: A benchmark for evaluating the performance of LLMs in optimization modeling, which could lead to improvements in the field. The research can be evaluated based on its methodology and findings.

title: Gap-K%: Measuring Top-1 Prediction Gap for Detecting Pretraining Data
summary: A method for measuring the top-1 prediction gap for detecting pretraining data, which could improve the transparency of LLMs. The research can be evaluated based on its methodology and findings.

title: Modeling Cascaded Delay Feedback for Online Net Conversion Rate Prediction: Benchmark, Insights and Solutions
summary: A benchmark and solutions for modeling cascaded delay feedback for online net conversion rate prediction, which could improve the performance of recommender systems. The research can be evaluated based on its methodology and findings.

title: [AINews] Moonshot Kimi K2.5 - Beats Sonnet 4.5 at half the cost, SOTA Open Model, first Native Image+Video, 100 parallel Agent Swarm manager
summary: Kimi K2.5 has reportedly beaten Sonnet 4.5 at half the cost, which could be a significant development in the field of AI. The claim can be evaluated based on its performance and capabilities.

title: GPT-5's Vision Checkup: a frontier VLM, but not a new SOTA
summary: GPT-5's vision capabilities have been evaluated, and while it is a frontier VLM, it is not a new SOTA. The evaluation can be used to understand the current state of the field.

title: [AINews] SOTA Video Gen: Veo 2 and Kling 2 are GA for developers
summary: Veo 2 and Kling 2 have been released as GA for developers, which could be a significant development in the field of video generation. The release can be evaluated based on its performance and capabilities.

title: Google releases Gemini 2.0 Flash with native tool use
summary: Gemini 2.0 Flash launched with native multimodal understanding and tool use. Speed claims to benchmark.

title: "Fine-tuning is dead — in-context learning does everything"
summary: Thread claiming that with 128K+ context windows, fine-tuning is unnecessary. Contradicts EXP-0002 findings on domain-specific tasks. Worth re-testing.

title: Anthropic publishes interpretability paper on Claude's reasoning
summary: New research on mechanistic interpretability revealing how Claude processes multi-step reasoning. Implications for understanding model reliability.

title: LangChain v0.3 drops 40% of abstractions
summary: Major refactor removing complexity. Relevant to Death Watch DW-0001. Does this extend or shorten the timeline?

title: "NVIDIA's margins will compress 50% by 2027 due to custom silicon"
summary: Financial prediction outside Ziggy's testing scope. Filed but not actionable.
